title: BlockSummary
description: Summary of transactions, protocol generated transfers, and chain parameters in a given block.

finalizationData.description: If the block contains a finalization record this contains its summary. Otherwise [None].

protocolVersion.description: Protocol version at which this block was baked. This is no more than [ProtocolVersion::P3]

specialEvents.description: Any special events generated as part of this block. Special events are protocol defined transfers, e.g., rewards, minting.

transactionSummaries.description: Outcomes of transactions in this block, ordered as in the block.

updates.description: Chain parameters, and any scheduled updates to chain parameters or the protocol.

finalizationData.description: If the block contains a finalization record this contains its summary. Otherwise [None].

protocolVersion.description: Protocol version at which this block was baked. This is at least [ProtocolVersion::P4]

specialEvents.description: Any special events generated as part of this block. Special events are protocol defined transfers, e.g., rewards, minting.

transactionSummaries.description: Outcomes of transactions in this block, ordered as in the block.

updates.description: Chain parameters, and any scheduled updates to chain parameters or the protocol.

AccessStructure.description: And access structure for performing chain updates. The access structure is only meaningful in the context of a list of update keys to which the indices refer to.

Address.description: Either an account or contract address. Some operations are allowed on both types of items, hence the need for this type.

ArInfo_for_HexString.description: Information on a single anonymity revoker held by the IP. Typically an IP will hold a more than one.

arDescription.description: description of the anonymity revoker (e.g. name, contact number)

arIdentity.description: unique identifier of the anonymity revoker

arPublicKey.description: elgamal encryption key of the anonymity revoker

AuthorizationsV0.description: Access structures for each of the different possible chain updates, togehter with the context giving all the possible keys.

addAnonymityRevoker.description: Access structure for adding new anonymity revokers.

addIdentityProvider.description: Access structure for adding new identity providers.

electionDifficulty.description: Access structure for updating the election difficulty.

euroPerEnergy.description: Access structure for updating the euro to energy exchange rate.

foundationAccount.description: Access structure for updating the foundation account address.

keys.description: The list of all keys that are currently authorized to perform updates.

microGTUPerEuro.description: Access structure for updating the microccd per euro exchange rate.

mintDistribution.description: Access structure for updating the mint distribution parameters.

paramGASRewards.description: Access structure for updating the gas reward distribution parameters.

poolParameters.description: Access structure for updating the pool parameters. For V0 this is only the baker stake threshold, for V1 there are more.

transactionFeeDistribution.description: Access structure for updating the transaction fee distribution.

AuthorizationsV1.description: Access structures for each of the different possible chain updates, togehter with the context giving all the possible keys.

addAnonymityRevoker.description: Access structure for adding new anonymity revokers.

addIdentityProvider.description: Access structure for adding new identity providers.

cooldownParameters.description: Keys for changing cooldown periods related to baking and delegating.

electionDifficulty.description: Access structure for updating the election difficulty.

euroPerEnergy.description: Access structure for updating the euro to energy exchange rate.

foundationAccount.description: Access structure for updating the foundation account address.

keys.description: The list of all keys that are currently authorized to perform updates.

microGTUPerEuro.description: Access structure for updating the microccd per euro exchange rate.

mintDistribution.description: Access structure for updating the mint distribution parameters.

paramGASRewards.description: Access structure for updating the gas reward distribution parameters.

poolParameters.description: Access structure for updating the pool parameters. For V0 this is only the baker stake threshold, for V1 there are more.

timeParameters.description: Keys for changing the lenghts of the reward period.

transactionFeeDistribution.description: Access structure for updating the transaction fee distribution.

BlockItemResult.description: Outcome of a block item execution.

oneOf.description: The intended action was completed. The sender was charged, if applicable. Some events were generated describing the changes that happened on the chain.
The intended action was not completed due to an error. The sender was charged, but no other effect is seen on the chain.

BlockItemSummary.description: Summary of the outcome of a block item.

cost.description: The amount of CCD the transaction was charged to the sender.

energyCost.description: The amount of NRG the transaction cost.

index.description: Index of the transaction in the block where it is included.

result.description: What is the outcome of this particular block item.

sender.description: Sender, if available. The sender is always available for account transactions.

type.description: Which type of block item this is.

BlockItemType.description: The type of the block item.

oneOf.description: Account transactions are transactions that are signed by an account. Most transactions are account transactions.
Credential deployments that create accounts are special kinds of transactions. They are not signed by the account in the usual way, and they are not paid for directly by the sender.
Chain updates are signed by the governance keys. They affect the core parameters of the chain.

ChainParametersV0.description: Values of chain parameters that can be updated via chain updates.

accountCreationLimit.description: The limit for the number of account creations in a block.

bakerCooldownEpochs.description: Extra number of epochs before reduction in stake, or baker deregistration is completed.

microGTUPerEuro.description: Micro ccd per euro exchange rate.

minimumThresholdForBaking.description: Minimum threshold for becoming a baker.

ChainParametersV1.description: Values of chain parameters that can be updated via chain updates.

accountCreationLimit.description: The limit for the number of account creations in a block.

bakingCommissionRange.description: The range of allowed baker commissions.

capitalBound.description: Maximum fraction of the total staked capital of that a new baker can have.

delegatorCooldown.description: Number of seconds that a delegator must cooldown when reducing their delegated stake.

finalizationCommissionRange.description: The range of allowed finalization commissions.

leverageBound.description: The maximum leverage that a baker can have as a ratio of total stake to equity capital.

microGTUPerEuro.description: Micro ccd per euro exchange rate.

minimumEquityCapital.description: Minimum equity capital required for a new baker.

passiveBakingCommission.description: Fraction of baking rewards charged by the passive delegation.

passiveFinalizationCommission.description: Fraction of finalization rewards charged by the passive delegation.

passiveTransactionCommission.description: Fraction of transaction rewards charged by the L-pool.

poolOwnerCooldown.description: Number of seconds that pool owners must cooldown when reducing their equity capital or closing the pool.

transactionCommissionRange.description: The range of allowed transaction commissions.

delegatorCooldown.description: Number of seconds that a delegator must cooldown when reducing their delegated stake.

poolOwnerCooldown.description: Number of seconds that pool owners must cooldown when reducing their equity capital or closing the pool.

CredentialType.description: Enumeration of the types of credentials.

oneOf.description: Delegate passively, i.e., to no specific baker.
Delegate to a specific baker.

Description.description: Description either of an anonymity revoker or identity provider. Metadata that should be visible on the chain.

Event.description: An event describing the changes that occurred to the state of the chain.

oneOf.description: A smart contract module was successfully deployed.
A new smart contract instance was created.

address.description: The newly assigned address of the contract.

amount.description: The amount the instance was initialized with.

events.description: Any contract events that might have been generated by the contract initialization.

ref.description: Module with the source code of the contract.

oneOf.description: A smart contract instance was updated.

amount.description: The amount the method was invoked with.

events.description: Any contract events that might have been generated by the contract execution.

instigator.description: The origin of the message to the smart contract. This can be either an account or a smart contract.

receiveName.description: The name of the method that was executed.

oneOf.description: An amount of CCD was transferred.

from.description: Sender, either smart contract instance or account.

to.description: Receiver. This will currently always be an account. Transferring to a smart contract is always an update.

oneOf.description: An account with the given address was created.

A new credential with the given ID was deployed onto an account. This is used only when a new account is created. See [Event::CredentialsUpdated] for when an existing account's credentials are updated.
A new baker was registered, with the given ID and keys.

aggregationKey.description: The new public key for verifying finalization records.

bakerId.description: ID of the baker whose keys were changed.

electionKey.description: The new public key for verifying whether the baker won the block lottery.

restakeEarnings.description: Whether the baker will automatically add earnings to their stake or not.

signKey.description: The new public key for verifying block signatures.

stake.description: The amount the account staked to become a baker. This amount is locked.

oneOf.description: A baker was scheduled to be removed.
A baker's stake was increased. This has effect immediately.
A baker's stake was scheduled to be decreased. This will have an effect on the stake after a number of epochs, controlled by the baker cooldown period.
The setting for whether rewards are added to stake immediately or not was changed to the given value.

restakeEarnings.description: The new value of the flag.

oneOf.description: The baker keys were updated. The new keys are listed.

aggregationKey.description: The new public key for verifying finalization records.

bakerId.description: ID of the baker whose keys were changed.

electionKey.description: The new public key for verifying whether the baker won the block lottery.

signKey.description: The new public key for verifying block signatures.

oneOf.description: Keys of the given credential were updated.
A new encrypted amount was added to the account.

account.description: The account onto which the amount was added.

encryptedAmount.description: The encrypted amount that was added.

newIndex.description: The index the amount was assigned.

oneOf.description: One or more encrypted amounts were removed from an account as part of a transfer or decryption.

inputAmount.description: The input encrypted amount that was removed.

newAmount.description: The new self encrypted amount on the affected account.

upToIndex.description: The index indicating which amounts were used.

oneOf.description: The public balance of the account was increased via a transfer from encrypted to public balance.
The encrypted balance of the account was updated due to transfer from public to encrypted balance of the account.

amount.description: The amount that was transferred from public to encrypted balance.

newAmount.description: The new self encrypted amount of the account.

oneOf.description: An update was enqueued for the given time.
A transfer with schedule was enqueued.

amount.description: The list of releases. Ordered by increasing timestamp.

oneOf.description: The credentials of the account were updated. Either added, removed, or both.

newCredIds.description: The credential ids that were added.

oneOf.description: Data was registered.
Memo
A V1 contract was interrupted.

address.description: Address of the contract that was interrupted.

events.description: Events generated up to the interrupt.

oneOf.description: A V1 contract resumed execution.

address.description: Address of the contract that is resuming.

success.description: Whether the interrupt succeeded or not.

oneOf.description: Updated open status for a baker pool
Updated metadata url for baker pool
Updated transaction fee commission for baker pool
Updated baking reward commission for baker pool
Updated finalization reward commission for baker pool

FinalizationSummary.description: Summary of the finalization record in a block, if any.

FinalizationSummaryParty.description: Details of a party in a finalization.

signed.description: Whether the party's signature is present

weight.description: The party's relative weight in the committee

GASRewards.description: The reward fractions related to the gas account and inclusion of special transactions.

accountCreation.description: `FeeAccountCreation`: fraction paid for including each account creation transaction in a block.

baker.description: `BakerPrevTransFrac`: fraction of the previous gas account paid to the baker.

chainUpdate.description: `FeeUpdate`: fraction paid for including an update transaction in a block.

finalizationProof.description: `FeeAddFinalisationProof`: fraction paid for including a finalization proof in a block.

HigherLevelAccessStructure_for_Level1Key.description: Either root, level1, or level 2 access structure. They all have the same structure, keys and a threshold. The phantom type parameter is used for added type safety to distinguish different access structures in different contexts.

HigherLevelAccessStructure_for_RootKeysK.description: Either root, level1, or level 2 access structure. They all have the same structure, keys and a threshold. The phantom type parameter is used for added type safety to distinguish different access structures in different contexts.

IpInfo_for_HexString.description: Public information about an identity provider.

ipCdiVerifyKey.description: Ed public key of the IP

ipDescription.description: Free form description, e.g., how to contact them off-chain

ipIdentity.description: Unique identifier of the identity provider.

ipVerifyKey.description: PS public key of the IP

Level1Update.description: An update with level 1 keys of either level 1 or level 2 keys. Each of the updates must be a separate transaction.

OpenStatus.description: The status of whether a baking pool allows delegators to join.

bakingCommissionRange.description: The range of allowed baker commissions.

capitalBound.description: Maximum fraction of the total staked capital of that a new baker can have.

finalizationCommissionRange.description: The range of allowed finalization commissions.

leverageBound.description: The maximum leverage that a baker can have as a ratio of total stake to equity capital.

minimumEquityCapital.description: Minimum equity capital required for a new baker.

passiveBakingCommission.description: Fraction of baking rewards charged by the passive delegation.

passiveFinalizationCommission.description: Fraction of finalization rewards charged by the passive delegation.

passiveTransactionCommission.description: Fraction of transaction rewards charged by the L-pool.

transactionCommissionRange.description: The range of allowed transaction commissions.

ProtocolUpdate.description: A generic protocol update. This is essentially an announcement of the update. The details of the update will be communicated in some off-chain way, and bakers will need to update their node software to support the update.

RejectReason.description:
A reason for why a transaction was rejected. Rejected means included in a block, but the desired action was not achieved. The only effect of a rejected transaction is payment.

NOTE: Some of the variant definitions can look peculiar, but they are made to be compatible with the serialization of the Haskell datatype.

oneOf.description: Error raised when validating the Wasm module.
As the name says.
Account does not exist.
Reference to a non-existing contract init method.
Reference to a non-existing contract receive method.
Reference to a non-existing module.
Contract instance does not exist.
Runtime exception occurred when running either the init or receive method.
When one wishes to transfer an amount from A to B but there are not enough funds on account/contract A to make this possible. The data are the from address and the amount to transfer.
Serialization of the body failed.
We ran of out energy to process this transaction.
Rejected due to contract logic in init function of a contract.
Reward account desired by the baker does not exist.
Proof that the baker owns relevant private keys is not valid.
Tried to add baker for an account that already has a baker
Tried to remove a baker for an account that has no baker
The amount on the account was insufficient to cover the proposed stake
The amount provided is under the threshold required for becoming a baker
The change could not be made because the baker is in cooldown for another change
A baker with the given aggregation key already exists
Encountered credential ID that does not exist
Attempted to add an account key to a key index already in use
When the account threshold is updated, it must not exceed the amount of existing keys
When the credential key threshold is updated, it must not exceed the amount of existing keys
Proof for an encrypted amount transfer did not validate.
Proof for a secret to public transfer did not validate.
Account tried to transfer an encrypted amount to itself, that's not allowed.
The provided index is below the start index or above `startIndex + length incomingAmounts`
The transfer with schedule is going to send 0 tokens
The transfer with schedule has a non strictly increasing schedule
The first scheduled release in a transfer with schedule has already expired
Account tried to transfer with schedule to itself, that's not allowed.
At least one of the credentials was either malformed or its proof was incorrect.
Some of the credential IDs already exist or are duplicated in the transaction.
A credential id that was to be removed is not part of the account.
Attemp to remove the first credential
The credential holder of the keys to be updated did not sign the transaction
Account is not allowed to have multiple credentials because it contains a non-zero encrypted transfer.
The account is not allowed to receive encrypted transfers because it has multiple credentials.
The account is not allowed to send encrypted transfers (or transfer from/to public to/from encrypted)
A configure baker transaction is missing one or more arguments in order to add a baker.
Finalization reward commission is not in the valid range for a baker
Baking reward commission is not in the valid range for a baker
Transaction fee commission is not in the valid range for a baker
Tried to add baker for an account that already has a delegator.
The amount on the account was insufficient to cover the proposed stake.
A configure delegation transaction is missing one or more arguments in order to add a delegator.
Delegation stake when adding a delegator was 0.
Account is not a delegation account.
Account is not a delegation account.
Delegation target is not a baker
The amount would result in pool capital higher than the maximum threshold.
The amount would result in pool with a too high fraction of delegated capital.
The pool is not open to delegators.

RootUpdate.description: An update with root keys of some other set of governance keys, or the root keys themselves. Each update is a separate transaction.

ScheduledUpdate_for_ArInfo_for_HexString.description: A scheduled update of a given type.

ScheduledUpdate_for_AuthorizationsV0.description: A scheduled update of a given type.

ScheduledUpdate_for_AuthorizationsV1.description: A scheduled update of a given type.

ScheduledUpdate_for_IpInfo_for_HexString.description: A scheduled update of a given type.

ScheduledUpdate_for_MintDistributionV1.description: A scheduled update of a given type.

ScheduledUpdate_for_PoolParameters.description: A scheduled update of a given type.

ScheduledUpdate_for_ProtocolUpdate.description: A scheduled update of a given type.

SpecialTransactionOutcome.description: In addition to the user initiated transactions the protocol generates some events which are deemed "Special outcomes". These are rewards for running the consensus and finalization protocols.

oneOf.description: Reward issued to all the bakers at the end of an epoch for baking blocks in the epoch.

remainder.description: Remaining balance of the baking account. This will be transfered to the next epoch's reward account. It exists since it is not possible to perfectly distribute the accumulated rewards. The reason this is not possible is that amounts are integers.

oneOf.description: Distribution of newly minted CCD.

foundationAccount.description: The address of the foundation account that the newly minted CCD goes to.

mintBakingReward.description: The portion of the newly minted CCD that goes to the baking reward account.

mintFinalizationReward.description: The portion that goes to the finalization reward account.

mintPlatformDevelopmentCharge.description: The portion that goes to the foundation, as foundation tax.

oneOf.description: Distribution of finalization rewards.

remainder.description: Remaining balance of the finalization reward account. It exists since it is not possible to perfectly distribute the accumulated rewards. The reason this is not possible is that amounts are integers.

oneOf.description: Reward for including transactions in a block.

baker.description: The account address where the baker receives the reward.

bakerReward.description: The amount of CCD that goes to the baker.

foundationAccount.description: The account address where the foundation receives the tax.

foundationCharge.description: The amount of CCD that goes to the foundation.

newGASAccount.description: New balance of the GAS account.

oldGASAccount.description: Previous balance of the GAS account.

transactionFees.description: Total amount of transaction fees in the block.

oneOf.description: Payment for the foundation.
Payment for a particular account. When listed in a block summary, the delegated pool of the account is given by the last PaydayPoolReward outcome included before this outcome.

bakerReward.description: The baking reward at payday to the account.

finalizationReward.description: The finalization reward at payday to the account.

transactionFees.description: The transaction fee reward at payday to the account.

oneOf.description: Amounts accrued to accounts for each baked block.

bakerId.description: The baker of the block, who will receive the award.

bakerReward.description: The amount awarded to the baker.

foundationCharge.description: The amount awarded to the foundation.

newGASAccount.description: The new balance of the GAS account.

oldGASAccount.description: The old balance of the GAS account.

passiveReward.description: The amount awarded to the passive delegators.

transactionFees.description: The total fees paid for transactions in the block.

oneOf.description: Payment distributed to a pool or passive delegators.

TimeParameters.description: The time parameters are introduced as of protocol version 4, and consist of the reward period length and the mint rate per payday. These are coupled as a change to either affects the overall rate of minting.

TransactionFeeDistribution.description: Update the transaction fee distribution to the specified value.

baker.description: The fraction that goes to the baker of the block.

gasAccount.description: The fraction that goes to the gas account. The remaining fraction will go to the foundation.

UpdateKeysCollectionSkeleton_for_Authori.description: The current collection of keys allowed to do updates. Parametrized by the chain parameter version.
The current collection of keys allowed to do updates. Parametrized by the chain parameter version.

UpdatePayload.description: The type of an update payload.

queue.description: Queue of updates, ordered by effective time.

UpdatesSkeleton_for_UpdateKeysCollection.description: State of updates. This includes current values of parameters as well as any scheduled updates.
